sense.name: (cause to) become less clear or indistinct
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] BLUR NP2[concrete] (and NP3[concrete]) NP1[theme] BLUR NP2[concrete] (and NP3[concrete])
sense.examples: The fog blurred the hills. When the rug got wet, the colors blurred. Tears blurred her eyes. The artist blurred blue and white in his painting.

sense.name: (cause to) become vague
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[theme] BLUR NP2[abastract] NP1[agent] BLUR NP2[abastract] NP1[abstract/plural] BLUR NOTE: This is a metaphorical usage of sense 1.
sense.examples: This is where the distinction between white and black blur. Her lecture all kind of blurred together. The professor blurred the definitions.
